intro: Ludwigia alternifolia var. typica, commonly known as the red Ludwigia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Onagraceae. It is native to South America and is characterized by its striking red or pink flowers and elongated, narrow leaves. The plant typically grows in aquatic or semi-aquatic environments, such as ponds and slow-moving streams. Its leaves are alternate and often display a bright red coloration, especially when exposed to strong lighting. This variety is popular in aquascaping due to its aesthetic appeal and ease of cultivation.
